title: Merge load balancer into controller
body:
This is the final piece that merges load controller into the controller.
1. Don't deploy loadbalancer and move the kafka partition parameter over to controller when deploying the latter.  
2. Include the source of the load balancer when compiling the controller.
3. Fix an earlier incomplete refactoring when publish(...) was not moved.
4. Add a switch to performLoadBalancer (in case we need to go back) and flip it to use internal load balancer.  Add missing transaction id parameter explicitly (easier because of how Backend and *API interact).

title: Python script to enforce coding conventions.
body:
A Python version of `scanCode.sh`, with extra checks. Born out of the frustration of having `git` continuously telling me that I have added EOL at the end of 20 files. Added checks for copyright headers which I thought was useful too (only for `.scala` and `.java` currently).

It currently reports 256 violations in 131 files of my pedantic standards. If accepted, I'll add a commit that fixes them all too.

(It also runs twice as fast as the original, for reasons I don't fully understand.)

title: Prepare load balancer merge
body:
This is the final preparatory push before merging load balancer into the controller.  The two main parts are:
1. Replace controller's http-centric postToLoadBalancer with a functional version by relegating http/rest and json-stuff to the lowest level.
2. Invert the layering of functionality in the loadbalancer so that the bottom layer is NOT an http service but rather the core load balancer functionality.  By sinking consul and kafka aspects to the lower LoadBalancerService and lifting the http stuff into LoadBalancer, the LoadBalancerService can be the new entry point for the controller.

title: Activate pre-warmed nodejs containers
body:
Enable use of pre-warm nodejs containers by providing an alternative path for promoting a pre-warmed container to a matching action.  The action must match both language (nodejs) and the memory limits.  Currently, only nodejs and standard memory limits are pre-warmed.  Other cases to be handled later.
1. getOnce renamed to getOrMake with parts of it factored out to retrieve
2. changeKey is used to support the promotion apropos the data structure
3. makeWhiskContainer now bifurcates to makeGeneralContainer (spin a new one up) and getWarmNodejsContainer (try to get a pre-existing warm one)

PPG 219

title: Maintain preallocated nodejs container
body:
PG 174 passed.

This commit is the 2nd phase of having pre-warmed nodejs containers and consists of having a thread that continually maintains N unspecialized containers that are part of the container pool data structure.  These containers are not yet used.  This incremental commit is intended to ensure that maintaining these containers is not harmful (before the final stage where we promote them for use).

title: add new property whisk.version.tag with image tag and expose on /api/
body:
v1 endpoint in controller

I enhanced the `/api/v1` endpoint in the controller by a new attribute that contains the tag of the docker images.

```
curl -k https://192.168.99.100/api/v1 -H "Authorization: MjNiYzQ2YjEtNzFmNi00ZWQ1LThjNTQtODE2YWE0ZjhjNTAyOjEyM3pPM3haQ0xyTU42djJCS0sxZFhZRnBYbFBrY2NPRnFtMTJDZEFzTWdSVTRWck5aOWx5R1ZDR3VNREdJd1A="
{
  "openwhisk": "hello",
  "version": "v1",
  "build": "2016-03-16T18:16:50:z",
  "tag": "latest"
}
```

title: Kafka 0.9
body:
Passed in playground 99.
1. fix typo in method name
2. remove deadcode classpath reference from build file
3. add cheerio package and move packages to nodejsAction Dockerfile
4. remove Kafka 0.8 references, upgrade to Kafka 0.9 and clean up imports
5. assign activations of triggers, rules to the same namespace as actions (subject default namespace)
6. add trigger payload to trigger activation
7. change type of quota exemptions from String to Set[Subject]
8. update Kafka tests and add new test for Kafka Connectors
9. in wsk CLI, separate reading HTTP response from JSON parsing so that if it possible to report an error from HTTP response, we can

In moving to Kafka 0.9, the deserialization of the raw message into an ActivationMessage is deferred to the Activator and Invoker so that the Kafka connector is agnostic of the message type. The streaming interface used from 0.8 is replaced with the polling API.

title: Change base url to use cloudant user.
body: Currently script, tries to work with `URL_BASE="https://$USER.cloudant.com"` where `$USER` is the user of local machine (computer host), which doesn't necessary same as `OPEN_WHISK_DB_USERNAME` the actual cloudant account username. Changed script to work with `OPEN_WHISK_DB_USERNAME` instead of `$USER`.

title: CouchDB + Travis CI
body:
Support for using CouchDB as an alternative to external Cloudant accounts.

One consequence is that Travis CI can now test the entire test suite without the need for outside credentials. This pull request sets that behavior to be the default for Travis CI builds.

title: Defer docker pause operation until after activation log
body: Return the container to the pool is performed after write activation record.  This removes the delay induced by "docker pause" and speeds up the activation completing.  Build 51.
